column4: i am still pretty new to ubuntu so i just offered a little thing that worked for me
i could never get firefox to play cool with wvm files with its embedded player.
i am in hopes that one day i will see someone ask that question and get a real answer that works for me
yes
i am sure there is a way to pick your embedded player for firefox, but i don't know how
let me define real so not to sound like an ass, real as in one that works for me. haha
oh!
haha
how do you uninstall a player?
and surely you can have more than one but define whichever one you want for firefox?
yes, you link to the plugin in /usr/lib/firefox/plugins
in the /usr/lib/firefox/plugins dir is there some file i should edit?
remove the plugins you don't want in there
the totem stuff for instance
no problem
not to keep bothering you but what i don't see anything close to mplayer in there.
do you have the mplayer plugins installed ?
sudo apt-get remove totem-mozilla
sudo apt-get install mozilla-mplayer
eventually add windows codecs.
did you install mozilla-mplayer ??
well ... :)
